perturbation.original_text: ISO shall collect completed and signed Application Materials and Merchant Processing Agreements from Applicants and shall forward them to SERVICERS within [***] [***] Business Days after the merchant is boarded (which may be accessed by SERVICERS online or forwarded to SERVICERS via ISO's automated application system or to a facsimile number designated by SERVICERS, provided such complies with the Rules and applicable laws, rules and regulations) or to any other place(s) as SERVICERS may designate for processing and document storage.
perturbation.changed_text: ISO shall collect completed and signed Application Materials and Merchant Processing Agreements from Applicants and shall forward them to SERVICERS within 30 Business Days after the merchant is boarded (which may be accessed by SERVICERS online or forwarded to SERVICERS via ISO's automated application system or to a facsimile number designated by SERVICERS, provided such complies with the Rules and applicable laws, rules and regulations) or to any other place(s) as SERVICERS may designate for processing and document storage.
perturbation.explanation: This modification extends the deadline for ISO to forward application materials and merchant processing agreements to SERVICERS to 30 business days. While seemingly generous, this could violate regulations requiring prompt submission of merchant data to acquiring banks for compliance and risk monitoring, especially in high-risk industries. The delay could lead to non-compliance with KYC (Know Your Customer) and AML (Anti-Money Laundering) regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: USA Patriot Act, Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) and related AML/KYC regulations.

perturbation.original_text: SERVICERS will transfer and assign all their interest in the Merchant Portfolio (including Merchant Processing Agreements and Merchant Accounts) and the dedicated BINs/ICAs to a Visa and MasterCard Member designated by ISO, provided first that: (a) all amounts due (or estimated to become due) in connection with each Merchant Processing Agreement and under this Agreement have been paid to SERVICERS; (b) the Termination Reserve Account has been adequately funded; (c) ISO provides full written indemnities to SERVICERS regarding actual and potential losses or other obligations arising out of operation of the Program or arising out of, or related to, this Agreement or any Merchant Processing Agreement; and (d) the Program Transfer complies with all applicable Rules, laws and regulations (the "Program Transfer").
perturbation.changed_text: SERVICERS will transfer and assign all their interest in the Merchant Portfolio (including Merchant Processing Agreements and Merchant Accounts) and the dedicated BINs/ICAs to a Visa and MasterCard Member designated by ISO, provided first that: (a) all amounts due (or estimated to become due) in connection with each Merchant Processing Agreement and under this Agreement have been paid to SERVICERS; (b) the Termination Reserve Account has not been adequately funded; (c) ISO provides full written indemnities to SERVICERS regarding actual and potential losses or other obligations arising out of operation of the Program or arising out of, or related to, this Agreement or any Merchant Processing Agreement; and (d) the Program Transfer complies with all applicable Rules, laws and regulations (the "Program Transfer").
perturbation.explanation: Changing (b) the termination reserve account has been adequately funded; to has not been adequately funded could potentially violate regulations related to winding down a merchant processing agreement. Regulations may require adequate funding of a termination reserve account to deal with fraud, returns, or other liabilities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Trade Commission Act, Visa/Mastercard Operating Regulations

perturbation.original_text:
SERVICERS may terminate this Agreement prior to its expiration for cause upon prior written notice to ISO as follows:

  (a)   Upon a Material breach of any representation, warranty or covenant in this Agreement by ISO which is not cured by ISO within sixty (60) days of receipt of written notice from SERVICERS; provided however, that if ISO is attempting in good faith to cure such breach within said sixty (60) day cure period but the nature of the breach prevents a cure within sixty (60) days, then ISO shall be allotted an additional number of days to cure, provided the total number of days of the cure period shall be no greater than one hundred twenty (120) days;
perturbation.changed_text:
SERVICERS may terminate this Agreement prior to its expiration for cause upon prior written notice to ISO as follows:

  (a)   Upon a Material breach of any representation, warranty or covenant in this Agreement by ISO which is not cured by ISO within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from SERVICERS; provided however, that if ISO is attempting in good faith to cure such breach within said ten (10) day cure period but the nature of the breach prevents a cure within ten (10) days, then ISO shall be allotted an additional number of days to cure, provided the total number of days of the cure period shall be no greater than fifteen (15) days;
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the cure period from 60 days (extendable to 120) to 10 days (extendable to 15 days) for a material breach can be problematic. Many breaches, especially those involving complex regulatory compliance issues, cannot realistically be resolved within such a short timeframe. This could violate principles of good faith and fair dealing, especially if the SERVICERS use this shortened period to unfairly terminate the agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of Contract Law - Good Faith and Fair Dealing.
